summary: The Canberra Embassy is mentioned in the context of a recommendation against declassifying Warren Commission document CD-971. Sir Charles Spry of the Australian Security Intelligence Organization (ASIO) raised concerns regarding the investigation of anonymous telephone calls to the Canberra Embassy before and after President Kennedy's assassination. These concerns led to a recommendation against declassification of the document.
significance: The Canberra Embassy is significant because it was the target of anonymous telephone calls before and after President Kennedy's assassination, prompting an investigation that is referenced in Warren Commission document CD-971. Concerns related to this investigation influenced a recommendation against declassifying the document.
